div.head: To the vvorshipful and his very good friend Maister Richard Candler, as one that wisheth the fauour of God long & happy life, encrease of worship, with continuall health and felicitie.
div.p: SO it is worshipfull Syr, I haue deuised with my selfe many times howe to gratifie you with some token of my good will towardes you, but welth and abilitie lacking to accomplish my desired pretence, yet nowe at the last, I haue presumed knowing your wonted curtesies towardes all men, to dedicate this Abstract of Plinies desiring you to take it with as good a will as I haue ment it, till hereafter that some seriusser matter come to my hande, and thus I bid you most hartely farewell in the Lord, who keepe you and all yours, prosper and preserue you in all your good and godly enterprises. Amen.
